text: Psalm 80
A Prayer to Restore Israel
For the \add music\add* director, according to \add The\add* Lilies.
A testimony. Of Asaph. A psalm.\f + \fr Ps 80 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Give ear, O shepherd of Israel,
\add who\add* leads Joseph like a flock.
Shine forth, \add you who\add* sits \add enthroned above\add* the cherubim.
Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh,
stir up your power
and come for our salvation.
O God, restore us,
and cause your face to shine that we may be saved.
O Yahweh God \add of\add* hosts,
⸤how long will you be angry⸥\f + \fr 80:4 \ft Literally “until when \fq your anger \ft smoke” \f*
against the prayer of your people?
You have fed them \add the\add* bread of tears;
you have given them tears to drink in full measure.\f + \fr 80:5 \ft The Hebrew “threefold” or “a third of a measure” is difficult \f*
You have made us \add an object of\add* strife to our neighbors,
and our enemies mock among themselves.
O God \add of\add* hosts, restore us
and cause your face to shine that we may be saved.
You uprooted a vine from Egypt;
you drove out \add the\add* nations and planted it.
You prepared \add a place\add* before it,
and ⸤it took deep root⸥\f + \fr 80:9 \ft Literally “its root rooted” \f* and filled \add the\add* land.
\add The\add* mountains were covered with its shade,
and \add the\add* mighty cedars \add with\add* its boughs.
It spread its branches to \add the\add* sea
and its shoots to \add the\add* river.
Why have you broken down its walls,
so that all \add who\add* pass on \add the\add* road pluck \add fruit from\add* it?
Swine from the forests devour\f + \fr 80:13 \ft Hebrew “devours” \f* it
and creatures of \add the\add* field feed on it.
Please return, O God \add of\add* hosts.
Observe from heaven and see,
and pay attention to this vine,
even\add the\add* stalk that your right hand planted,
and concerning \add the\add* shoot\f + \fr 80:15 \ft Hebrew “son” \f* you strengthened for yourself.
\add It is\add* burned with fire, cut down.
They perish at the rebuke of your face.
Let your hand be on the man of your right hand,
on \add the\add* son of humankind \add whom\add* you made strong for yourself.
Then we will not turn back from you.
Restore us to life, and we will proclaim your name.
O Yahweh God \add of\add* hosts, restore us;
cause your face to shine that we may be saved.
